alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Debris flows are also possible in steep terrain, especially near recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Colville, Chewelah, Newport, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Kootenai, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Nordman, Copeland, Kettle Falls, Ione, Northport, Springdale, Metaline Falls and Cusick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
